content: plush braided headband by jane li ©yevgeniya li 2025 pattern overview this plush headband with an unusual braid is stylish classy and wide enough to keep your ears warm the headband consists of three sections a part with increases a braid cable pattern worked on 24 stitches and a part with decreases multiple finishing options are provided at the end i made mine with a button so it s easy to put it on and take it off without messing with my hair size the sample shown is approximately 9 cm wide and 53 cm long however there is no set size - instructions in the pattern explain how to get the right length using your own head as a gauge the width of the headband will depend on your yarn gauge and needles yarn any aran or worsted yarn will work the chunkier your yarn the wider your headband will be yarn used in the sample moda vera daisy 10 ply 62 meters used needles us 7 / 4 5mm - us 9 / 5 5mm needles needle sizes are only a suggestion this is knit back and forth in row so you can use straight or circular needles sample is knitted with us 7 / 4 5mm needles you will also need one cable needle for the braid pattern ©yevgeniya li 2025 - personal use only 1 gauge 16-19 sts in stockinette please note that the gauge in cables is tighter than in plain stockinette example the headband shown in the sample is only about 9 cm despite being knitted across 26 stitches skills and techniques cast on and bind off knit purl decrease k2tog k3tog ssk increase m1l m1r working yarn overs working cables abbreviations 3/3 lc - left cable slip next 3 sts to cn and hold in front of work k3 from the left needle then k3 from cn 3/3 rc - right cable slip next 3 sts to cn and hold at the back of work k3 from the left needle then k3 from cn bobble - bind off co - cast on cn - cable needle k2tog - knit two stitches together k3tog - knit three stitches together m1l - make 1 left knitwise left leaning increase from the front lift loop between stitches with left needle knit the loop you picked up through the back m1r - make 1 right knitwise right leaning increase from the back lift loop between stitches with left needle knit the loop you picked up through the front loop rs - right side of work slip_stitch - selvage stitch to create neat edges the first stitch of each row always slip knitwise the last stitch of each row always purl ssk - slip one stitch slip another stitch knit these 2 stitches together st / sts - stitch stitches ws - wrong side of work yo - yarn over part with increases row 2 rs slip_stitch k1 mlr k1 m1l k1 slip_stitch 2 sts increased total 7
